news.headline: Kotak Mahindra Bank Q4 FY25 Net Profit Falls 14% to ₹3,552 Crore
news.text: Kotak Mahindra Bank reported a 14% year-on-year decline in net profit for Q4 FY25, amounting to ₹3,552 crore. The decrease is attributed to higher provisions for bad loans. The bank's net interest income rose by 5% to ₹7,284 crore, while the net interest margin narrowed to 4.97% from 5.28% a year earlier. The board recommended a dividend of ₹2.50 per share for FY25.

news.headline: Kotak Mahindra Bank's Loan Growth Slows to 13% in Q4 FY25
news.text: In Q4 FY25, Kotak Mahindra Bank's loan growth slowed to 13%, which analysts considered underwhelming. The bank's gross non-performing assets (NPA) ratio slightly increased to 1.42%, while the net NPA improved to 0.31%. The bank's average liquidity coverage ratio stood at 135% for the quarter.

news.headline: Kotak Mahindra Bank's Stock Declines Amid Concerns Over Credit Costs
news.text: On May 5, 2025, Kotak Mahindra Bank's shares fell by 5.5% following its Q4 FY25 earnings report. The decline was driven by concerns over higher credit costs and slower loan growth. Despite the drop, the stock remains up approximately 16% year-to-date, outperforming the broader Nifty Bank index.

news.headline: Kotak Mahindra Bank's Q3 FY25 Net Profit Rises 10% to ₹3,305 Crore
news.text: In Q3 FY25, Kotak Mahindra Bank reported a 10% year-on-year increase in net profit to ₹3,305 crore. The bank's net interest income grew by 10% to ₹7,196 crore, while the net interest margin stood at 4.93%. Operating profit for the quarter increased by 13% to ₹5,181 crore.
